intro: Pastinaca tordylium, commonly known as the golden burr. It is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia, characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flowers and spiny seed pods. The plant belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its medicinal properties. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often hairy, while its stems are erect and can grow up to 1 meter in height. The plant thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and along stream banks.
